title: Sure, here is a list of 20 articles that cover topics related to dataset annotation aggregation and interpreting multiple expert annotators
container-title: These articles span various approaches, methodologies, and applications in this area up to 2021

title: Maximum likelihood estimation of observer error-rates using the EM algorithm
container-title: Journal of the Royal Statistical Society

title: This foundational paper introduces a statistical method for estimating error rates of multiple annotators
Cheap and fast—but is it good? Evaluating non-expert annotations for natural language tasks
container-title: Proceedings of the 2008 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing

title: This paper evaluates the quality of non-expert annotations and discusses methods for aggregating them
Learning from crowds
container-title: Journal of Machine Learning Research

title: The authors propose a probabilistic model to aggregate annotations from multiple annotators
Get another label? Improving data quality and data mining using multiple, noisy labelers
container-title: Proceedings of the 14th ACM SIGKDD International Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining

title: This paper discusses strategies for improving data quality by using multiple annotators
The multidimensional wisdom of crowds
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems, 23.**

title: The authors explore the aggregation of annotations in a multi-dimensional space
Whose vote should count more: Optimal integration of labels from labelers of unknown expertise
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems, 22.**

title: This paper presents a method to weigh annotations based on the expertise of annotators
Quality management on Amazon Mechanical Turk
container-title: Proceedings of the ACM SIGKDD Workshop on Human Computation

title: The authors discuss quality management techniques for crowdsourced annotations
Active learning from multiple noisy labelers with varied expertise
container-title: Proceedings of the 2010 European Conference on Machine Learning and Knowledge Discovery in Databases

title: This paper introduces active learning techniques to handle multiple noisy annotators
Iterative learning for reliable crowdsourcing systems
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems, 24.**

title: The authors propose an iterative algorithm for improving the reliability of crowdsourced annotations
Variational inference for crowdsourcing
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems, 25.**

title: This paper presents a variational inference approach to model crowdsourced annotations
Bayesian classifier combination
container-title: Proceedings of the 15th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Statistics

title: The authors propose a Bayesian approach to combine classifiers, which can be extended to annotator aggregation
Learning from the wisdom of crowds by minimax entropy
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems, 25.**

title: This paper introduces a minimax entropy principle for aggregating crowd-sourced labels
Who said what: Modeling individual labelers improves classification
container-title: Proceedings of the AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence

title: The authors propose a model that accounts for individual annotator characteristics to improve classification
Comparing Bayesian models of annotation
container-title: Transactions of the Association for Computational Linguistics

title: This paper compares different Bayesian models for annotation aggregation
Deep learning from crowds
container-title: Proceedings of the 32nd AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence

title: The authors explore deep learning methods for learning from crowdsourced annotations
A deep generative model for label noise
container-title: Proceedings of the 36th International Conference on Machine Learning

title: This paper introduces a deep generative model to handle noisy labels from multiple annotators
Robust Bayesian inference for crowdsourcing in the presence of spammers
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems

title: The authors propose a robust Bayesian inference method to handle spammers in crowdsourcing
Dynamic Bayesian combination of multiple imperfect classifiers
container-title: Decision Making and Imperfection

title: This paper presents a dynamic Bayesian approach to combine multiple imperfect classifiers, applicable to annotation aggregation
The social impact of natural language processing
container-title: Proceedings of the 54th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics

title: This paper discusses the social implications of NLP, including the aggregation of annotations from diverse groups
Learning from noisy large-scale datasets with minimal supervision
container-title: Proceedings of the IEEE Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition

title: The authors propose methods for learning from large-scale, noisy datasets with minimal supervision
These articles provide a broad overview of the various methodologies and challenges associated with dataset annotation aggregation and interpreting multiple expert annotators
